results.title: Art for everybody
results.brief_description: The function of an art gallery in the community. Sequences show the variety of interests a gallery can hold for people - exhibitions of great art from many nations, festivals of dancing and music. Even more important is the part a gallery can play in the development of imagination and talent in a child. Through happy participation in painting, modelling activities, costume-making and pageants, children learn about art.

constellations_other.name: Women in charge
constellations_other.description: Across documentary, film, TV, and visual art, Aboriginal women have led how they will be represented on-screen.

results.title: Art and the community
results.brief_description: This film is a Commonwealth Teleview. Sir William Emrys Williams, Secretary-General of the Arts Council of Great Britain, answers questions put to him by Rooney Pelletier on various aspects of art sponsorship, with particular reference to the encouragement of opera, the theatre, music, ballet, painting and sculpture in Britain. No other credits available.

results.title: Art and reality: the Renaissance
results.creator_credit: John Seabourne, Seabourne Enterprises, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and John Warner
results.brief_description: This film illustrates the fundamental change form Byzantine symbolism to Renaissance humanism. A simple but comprehensive study is made of composition and perspective, the visual aspects of painting and on attitudes inspired by early Renaissance humanism. Suitable for Lower-Upper Secondary students.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Seabourne, Seabourne Enterprises, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and John Warner

results.title: Art and motion
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Paul Burnford Productions
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the relationships between movement in nature, in space-time concepts, and in abstract art forms. Shows the relationship between space and motion in the mobiles of Calder and Usher, in the paintings of Balla, Kadinsky and Van Gogh, and in the abstract film “Colour Fragments” by Elwood Decker.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Burnford, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Paul Burnford Productions

results.title: Art and life in Italy
results.brief_description: Italy: the countryside, architecture and sculpture. Rome: the Colosseum, Pantheon, and St Peter’s Cathedral, church interiors, mosaics; a Giotto fresco. Florence: Cathedral dome and bronze doors, Medici palaces, Raphael’s painting. Botticelli’s “Adoration of the Magi”: Della Robbia’s “Singing Angels” and Michelangelo’s “Figure of Moses”. Venice : the churches. No other credits available.

results.title: Art
results.brief_description: Presents a short and frantic history of painting and graphics, combined with Beethoven’s Fifth Symphony. Uses an animated still-picture technique, sometimes called “kinestasis”.
